paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the role of Hsp40 chaperones in the degradation of the hERG potassium channel, specifically focusing on the trafficking mutant G601S in the KCNH2 gene. No detailed penetrance data or individual patient records are provided.

functional_data.summary: The G601S variant affects the trafficking of the hERG channel, leading to its degradation.

variants.additional_notes: The paper focuses on the molecular mechanisms affecting the hERG channel rather than clinical data.
key_quotes: Both the DJAs and CHIP reduce hERG stability and act differentially on folding intermediates of hERG and the disease-related trafficking mutant G601S.

challenges: Limited clinical data available in the paper
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily discusses molecular and cellular mechanisms without detailed patient data.
